Specific Details: Material Amendment to the Draft Meath County Development Plan zoning agricultural lands at Killegland, Ashbourne to Open Space.
DPOs Lobbied: Amanda Smith|Councillor|Meath County Council::Conor Tormey|Councillor|Meath County Council::Brian Fitzgerald|Councillor|Meath County Council::Aisling O'Neill|Councillor|Meath County Council::Suzanne Jamal|Councillor|Meath County Council::Alan Tobin|Councillor|Meath County Council::Sharon Keogan|Senator|Seanad
Subject Matter: Material Amendment to the Draft Meath County Development Plan zoning agricultural lands at Killegland, Ashbourne to Open Space.
Intended Results: To propose to the Councillors that the Material Amendment to zone land at Killegland, Ashbourne from agricultural land to Open Space not be made at this stage of the Draft County Development Plan process but that the Open Space zoning at Killegland should be looked at during the Ashbourne Local Area Plan process.::To notify Councillors that we would be making a detailed submission fully outlining the reasoning behind our proposal and to highlight the major issues that would arise should the Material Amendment remain as drafted. The submission was subsequently lodged to Meath County Council.
Lobbying Activities:
Proposed to the Councillors that the Material Amendment to zone land at Killegland, Ashbourne from agricultural land to Open Space not be made at this stage of the Draft County Development Plan process but that the Open Space zoning at Killegland should be looked at during the Ashbourne Local Area Plan process.
Also notified Councillors that we would be making a detailed submission fully outlining the reasoning behind our proposal and highlighted the major issues that would arise should the Material Amendment remain as drafted. The submission was subsequently lodged to Meath County Council.|Phone call|6-10::Proposed to the Councillors that the Material Amendment to zone land at Killegland, Ashbourne from agricultural land to Open Space not be made at this stage of the Draft County Development Plan process but that the Open Space zoning at Killegland should be looked at during the Ashbourne Local Area Plan process.
Also notified Councillors that we would be making a detailed submission fully outlining the reasoning behind our proposal and highlighted the major issues that would arise should the Material Amendment remain as drafted. The submission was subsequently lodged to Meath County Council.|Email|6-10::Proposed to the Councillors that the Material Amendment to zone land at Killegland, Ashbourne from agricultural land to Open Space not be made at this stage of the Draft County Development Plan process but that the Open Space zoning at Killegland should be looked at during the Ashbourne Local Area Plan process.
Also notified Councillors that we would be making a detailed submission fully outlining the reasoning behind our proposal and highlighted the major issues that would arise should the Material Amendment remain as drafted. The submission was subsequently lodged to Meath County Council.|Meeting|1

Specific Details: Virtual Meeting with Senator Sharon Keogan.
Subject Matter: Virtual Meeting with Senator Sharon Keogan.
Intended Results: To brief the Senator on Braymore WInd Park, and to establish a relationship with the Senator.

Specific Details: Material Amendment to the Draft Meath County Development Plan zoning agricultural lands at Killegland, Ashbourne to Open Space
Subject Matter: Material Amendment to the Draft Meath County Development Plan zoning agricultural lands at Killegland, Ashbourne to Open Space
Intended Results: To propose that the Material Amendment to zone land at Killegland, Ashbourne from agricultural land to Open Space should not be made at this stage of the Draft County Development Plan process as any Open Space zoning at Killegland should be dealt with during the Ashbourne Local Area Plan process.::To notify and discuss the detailed submission lodged to Meath County Council which fully outlines the reasoning behind our proposal and to highlight the major issues that would arise should the Material Amendment be voted for by Councillors to remain as drafted.::To discuss the recently published recommendation of Meath County Council's Chief Executive to make a modification to the area of land affected by the Material Amendment.
Lobbying Activities:
To propose that the Material Amendment to zone land at Killegland, Ashbourne from agricultural land to Open Space should not be made at this stage of the Draft County Development Plan process as any Open Space zoning at Killegland should be dealt with during the Ashbourne Local Area Plan process.
Also to notify and discuss the detailed submission lodged with Meath County Council which fully outlines the reasoning behind our proposal and to highlight the major issues that would arise should the Material Amendment be voted for by Councillors to remain as drafted.
To discuss the recently published recommendation of Meath County Council's Chief Executive to make a modification to the area of land affected by the Material Amendment.|Phone call|2-5
